div.p: BATTLE or DE BELLO (Abbey of). Richard, the abbot, and convent of Battle notify that Thomas, bp. of Norwich, has granted and confirmed to the said abbey the church of Ixning in his diocese, to be appropriated to the use of the abbey after the death of George Vercellengio, rector, and Wido, vicar of the said church, saving to the vicar 25 marks. Dated at Battle, 1229, 5 Ides November. MS. Ch. Sussex 77.

Richard, the abbot, and convent of Battle recite the appropriation of the church of Ixning, Norwich diocese, and the ordination of the vicarage, the salary of the vicar being fixed at six marks, with a house &c. Dated 5 Ides November, 1229. MS. Ch. Sussex 78.

BOREHAM and ROKELANDE. Indenture made 8 July, 21 Hen. VIII, by which the dean and canons of Cardinal College, Oxford, lease to George Jenour of Hurst, Sussex, all their lordship of Boreham and Rokelande for 21 years, at an annual rent of £19. [English] MS. Ch. Sussex 79.

BRADEBRUGGE manor, in Bosham. John de Clympesfold constitutes William de Clympesfolde his attorney to deliver to Roger his son seisin of two fields &c., as is contained in a certain charter. Dated at his house in Bradebrugge, 14 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 80.

BRIGHT WELL (Del Hame, near). Thomas del Hame grants to William del Hame a piece of land lying between the land of Matilda, daughter of Ralph del Hame, and the bank which leads towards Britwelle. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Sussex 81.
COKEFELD. Release from Ralph Britte of London, draper, to William Britte of Cokefeld in Sussex, for all actions and demands to this date. Dated at Reygate, 2 Oct., 17 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 83.

EWEKENE (SURREY). Joan, formerly the wife of Maurice de Ewekene, grants to Maurice de Ewekene, son and heir of Maurice de Ewekene, one piece of land in Ewekene, part of her dowry, containing two acres and 1½ roods, between the cemetery of Ewekene and the high road going towards Horsham. Dated at Ewekene, Monday, 3 November, 9 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 83A

William Whythard grants to Roger de Kenlee and Joan his wife, one messuage and 30 acres of land in Ewekene, which he had by the gift of the said Roger, with reversion failing heir male to their daughters Alice and Matilda. Dated at Ewekene the Sunday next after the feast of St. Luke the evangelist, 20 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 83B.

Peter Bonat grants to Robert Bonat his father one piece of land in the parish of Ewekene, which he lately had from him, near the road leading to Dorkynge, with reversion to ... his daughters Isabella and Agnes. Dated at Ewekene the Sunday next before the feast of the Annunciation B. V. M., 13 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 83C.

Roger de Kenele grants to Thomas, son of Robert Bonat, and Alice his wife, all his lands and tenements in the parish of Euwekene. Dated at Ewekene the Sunday next before the feast of St. Thomas the apostle, 16 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 83D.

Convention made between Thomas Bonet of Ewekene of the one part, and William le Schyghelere of the other, being a grant of one piece of land in Ockelegh, lying near the land of Oslynhhurst, to hold the same from the feast of St. Michael, 19 Ed. III, for 3 years. MS. Ch. Sussex 83E

GRINSTEAD (West). Presentation of Richard Rande, M.A., to the church of West Grinstead, vacant by the death of Robert Scott, by William Blunt and Cecilia his wife, the patrons. Dated 6 March, 1620. MS. Ch. Sussex 84.

HAILSHAM. Mutilated deed, dated ... after St Augustine of England, 1282, of proceedings at the cathedral church of Rochester in a suit between the prior and convent of Michelham and Eustace .... concerning the chapel or church of Haylesham. [Fragment.] MS. Ch. Sussex 166.

John Pottere of Haylesham grants to John Fakham, Richard Page, John Blakstok and Thomas atte Wode, lands, rents, and services in Haylesham &c., to hold according to the custom of the manor of Alston. Dated at Haylesham, 1 July, 4 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 85.

William Marmyun grants and quit-claims for himself and heirs, to his men of Haylesham all rents, services, and customs as contained in a charter of Robert Marmyun his father, on certain conditions of payments of reliefs, etc. [13th century; copy undated, late 15th century] MS. Ch. Sussex 86.

HELLINGLEY and WALDEBN. Richard de Grenstede grants to Robert de Charlokeston, the whole of the land in Hellingelege and Walderne that he bought of sir John de Gatesden, and which was formerly William le Tornur's . [c. 1270-80] MS. Ch. Sussex 103.

HERYNGHAM (Priory of). Charter (indented) by which the prior and convent of Heryngham demise to John Eyloue , clerk, the tithes of the ancient demesne of Sir William Dautrey ('de alta ripa') in Warnecamp for 20 years at an annual rent of 10s. Dated at Heryngham in the feast of St. Gregory, 15 Hen. VI. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 104.

HEYSHETT and SUTTON. Grant of free warren by K. Hen. III, to John de Percy, in all his lands of Heyshette and Suttone in the county of Sussex. Dated at Wodestok, 10 August, 36 Hen. [III]. Witnesses, Galf. de Lezinnan fratre nostro, etc. MS. Ch. Sussex 105.

HORSHAM. Lambert, son of Walter, son of Christiana de Uckefeud, grants to William de la Denne, for his service &c. and 10 marks sterling, the whole of his land called 'La Hulle' in Horsham, which Simon Terry gave to his mother Lucy. (c. 1270-80.) [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 108.

William de Brawse grants to John de la Denne, for his fealty and 100s., the whole of the land called which Richard de le Denne, his father, held in the parish of Horsham, and also the land which Alwin de Wolegete held, paying annually 8s. 2d. (c. 1260.) [With seal of arms, perfect.] MS. Ch. Sussex 109.

Alice, formerly wife of John de Crochurst, grants to William atte Denne of Horsham two fields of land lying in the parish of Horsham, which came to her on the death of her husband, called Northrud and Stoneyehaghe; for her life at an annual rent of 3s.. Dated at Horsham on the vigil of St. Margaret, 11 Ed. [I]. MS. Ch. Sussex 110.
Richard, son of John de la Denne, grants to William de la Denne his brother for 20s., 3s. of annual rent in the parish of Horsham. (c. 1280.) MS. Ch. Sussex 111.

Alice, wife of John de Crochurst of the parish of Horsham, remits and quit-claims to Nicholas ate Rideforde all her right as dowry in lands and tenements in Horsham, which the said Nicholas had from her late husband. Dated at Horsham the Sunday on the morrow of St. Barnabas, 23 Ed. I. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 112.

Godfrey, son and heir of John de Krochurst, is bound to William ate Donne of Horsham and his heirs in a sum of £10, not to sell any of his land to anyone but the said William if the latter will give as much as another. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next after the feast of St. John the Baptist, 8 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 113.

Godfrey, son of John de Krochurst of Horsham, grants to William atte Denne of Horsham for 40s. a certain meadow called Hosemede in the parish of Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next after the Nativity of St. John the Baptist, 8 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 114.

Alice, relict of John de Krochurst, remits and quit-claims to William atte Denne all her right in a field called 'Le Hosemede' in the parish of Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Tuesday on the feast of the Epiphany, 9 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 115

Convention between Godfrey de Crokhurst and William, son of the lady Mary de Brewose, dated 27 Nov., 11 Ed. II, by which Godfrey leases to William 10 acres and one rood of land in a certain place called Hallecroft in Crokhurst in the parish of Horsham, together with a certain way, for five years. [Dated at the end Friday after the feast of St Andrew [1 Dec.], at Crokhurst] [With seal of arms, perfect.] MS. Ch. Sussex 116.

Godfrey de Crochurst grants to William atte Denne one messuage and garden and 14 acres of arable land at Crothurst in Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Thursday next after the feast of the Trinity, 14 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 117.

Godfrey de Crochurst is bound to pay to William atte Denne 100s. sterling at the feast of the Nativity of our Lord following two years. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next after the Nativity of St. John the Baptist, 14 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 118.
Convention dated the Monday next before the feast of St. Augustine, 15 Ed. II, by which Godfrey de Krothurst grants to William atte Denne one field called Brodefeld in Horsham. MS. Ch. Sussex 119.
Duplicate of Ch. 119. MS. Ch. Sussex 120.

Godfrey de Crokhurst of Horsham remits and quit-claims to William atte Denne of Horsham and Joan his wife all right in the lands, rents, &c. which the said William and Joan have by demise from him for their lives and which came to him by heirship on the death of John de Crokhurst his father, with the reversion of other lands and of those held by his mother, in Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next after the Nativity of St. John the Baptist, 1 6 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 121.

William de Brewouse , jun., remits and quit-claims to William atte Denne and Joan his wife all right in three acres of land at Crochurst in the parish of Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Wednesday on the feast of the Holy Innocents, 17 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 122.

Alice, formerly wife of John le Hunte, remits and quitclaims to Simon Betheleg all right in 3 acres of land in Crochurst in Horsham, which he bought from her late husband. Dated at Horsham, 4 June, 17 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 123.

Robert atte Lynde of Horsham and Matilda his wife grant to William atte Denne and Joan his wife the whole of their land which they have at Crochurst in Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next before the feast of St. Barnabas, apostle, 18 Ed. II. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 124.

John le Hounte, son of the late John le Hounte of Baddynggemere, grants to William atte Denne of Horsham and Joan his wife 3 acres of land at Crochurst in Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Thursday on the feast of All Saints, 18 Ed. II. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 125.

Simon Betheleg of Horsham remits and quit-claims to John le Hounte of Baddynggemere all right in 3 acres of land which lies in the village of Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Friday on the feast of St. Laurence, martyr, 18 Ed. II. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 126.

William atte Thorne and Joan his wife confirm to William atte Denne of Horsham all that curtilage and land at Crochurst in Horsham which they formerly obtained from William de Brewouse , junior. Dated at Horsham the Thursday on the morrow of the Nativity of St. John the Baptist, 1 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 127.

Richard de Wystnestone , vicar of Horsham, grants to Richard Hoys of Horsham and Joan his wife and Henry their son two messuages in Horsham, at an annual rent of 5s. to him during his life. Dated at Horsham the Sunday on the feast of St. Gregory, 3 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 128.

William atte Denne of Horsham grants to John le Willere and Agnes his wife two acres of land and buildings thereone in Horsham, for 40 years at an annual rent of 12d. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next after the feast of St. Martin, 5 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 129.

Reginald Coulum of Horsham grants to Joan, daughter of William atte Denne, one field of land in Horsham, with remainder to her sister Katherine. Dated at Horsham, 7 March, 6 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 130.

Convention between John de Clympesfolde and Alice his wife of one part, and Richard de Kauntebrugge , clerk, of the other, by which
John and Alice lease to Richard one messuage and a curtilage in Horsham for 5 years at an annual rent of 7s. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next after the feast of the Purification, 8 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 131.

William atte Denne of Horsham grants to Richard le Saghiere of Horsham one acre and a half of land lying on the north and west of a field called Le Hulle in Horsham, with remainder to Richard's sister Alice; paying 6d. yearly. Dated at Horsham the Saturday next after the feast of the Epiphany, 9 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 132.

Ranulph Randekyn of Horsham grants to Roger, son of John de Clympesfold, 40d. of annual rent from a field called 'Le Hulle' [in Horsham], held by John Plymping, which rent William atte Denne granted to him the said Ranulph Randekyn. Dated at Slyndefold the Tuesday next after the feast of St. Andrew apostle, 9 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 133.

Thomas, son of Matilda atte Budeles of Fyndon, and Agnes his wife quit-claim to William atte Denne of Horsham and Joan his wife all right in those lands at Crokehurst in Horsham which the said William formerly acquired from William, father of the said Agnes. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next before the Annunciation of the Virgin, 16 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 134.

William atte Denne of Horsham grants to Richard Whetlond of the same, one piece of land of a certain field called Stonyenehaghe in Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next before the feast of St. Matthias, 17 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 135.

William atte Denne of Horsham confirms to Alan le Willere and Alice his wife the two acres of land [in Horsham] acquired of William atte Denne his father, and one croft of land acquired by William le Willere, father of the said Alan, of the above William, paying yearly for the same 2s. 4d. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next after the feast of SS. Simon and Jude, 18 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 136.

John, son of William atte Denne of Horsham, confirms to William atte Denne his brother 4d. of annual rents which he was accustomed to receive from Peter le Turnour and Isabella his wife for a croft in Horsham which was Roger le Mareschal's. Dated at Horsham the Saturday next before the feast of the Annunciation of the Blessed Virgin, 22 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 137.

William Herebard and Isabella his wife of Horsham grant to Richard le Wyllere of the same, one croft of land called Wodegatescroft in Horsham, with remainder. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next before the feast of St. Margaret, virgin, 36 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 138.

William Herberd and Thomas le Ventre grant to Robert le Smyth of Horsham one building in Horsham, paying yearly 3s. 4d. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next after the Translation of St. Thomas, 36 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 139.

William Herbard of Horsham and Thomas le Ventre of Rouspere grant to Robert Smyth the above building in in market-place of Horsham for 37 years without rent, in consideration of the repairs of the house. Dated at Horsham the Thursday before the feast of St. Margaret, 38 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 140.

Isabella Herbard, widow, grants to William Merlat, jun., and Simon Ingram of London, linen-draper, all her lands and tenements, rents and services which she has in the village and fields of Horsham. Dated at Horsham on the feast of Carniprivium [Septuagesima Sunday], 42 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 141.

Henry Tuttebury of Horsham and Lucy his wife remit and quitclaim to Walter Bradbrugge of Slyndefold and Isabell his wife all right in lands and tenements called Gobetteslonde in the parish of Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Monday next before the feast of St. Michael, 14 Rich. II. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 142.

Writ of King Richard II to John Wadham and William Hankford constituting them justices in a cause of disseisin between Isabella atte Denne and Walter Bradbrugge and Isabella his wife, against Henry Tuttebury, Lucy his wife, and John Grauntford, concerning tenements in Horsham. Dated at Westminster, 17 April, 13 Rich. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 143.

Gilbert Oste and Margery his wife grant to Walter Bonewyke and Geoffrey Schadde all their lands &c. in Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Sunday next before the feast of St. Bartholomew, 19 Rich. II. [With two seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 144.

William Jourdan and Thomas Prowte grant to Maud atte Denne, who was the wife of Geoffrey Huwet of Horle, an annual rent of 3s. 4d. from lands and tenements called Maschales in the borough of Horsham. Dated at Horsham, 20 March, 6 Hen. IV. [With two seals.] [French] MS. Ch. Sussex 145.

William Jourdan and Thomas Prowte demise and confirm to Thomas Wodehech and Leticia his wife all the lands and tenements called Maschales in the borough of Horsham, which they lately had by the gift of Matilda atte Denne. Dated at Horsham, 2 April, 6 Henry IV. [With seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 146.

Matilda Huwet of Horle grants to William Jordan, William Chelsham, and William Hogesworthe all lands &c. which she has in the parish of Horesham. Dated at Horsham on the feast of St. Laurence, 8 Hen. IV. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 147.

Indenture between William Jordan, William Chelsham, and William Hegesworthe of the one part, and Thomas Prowte of Horsham of the other, by which the said parties of the first part demise to the said Thomas Prowte the lands, rents, and services in Horsham, which they had from Matilda Hewet, to hold for the term of 8 years. Dated at Horsham on the feast of the Assumption, 8 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 148.

William Jordan, William Chelsham, and William Eggesworthe demise to Thomas Prowte of Horsham all the lands, rents, &c. in the parish of Horsham which they lately had by the gift of Matilda Hewet. Dated at Horsham on the feast of Corpus Christi, 10 Hen. IV. [With three seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 149.

Alice atte Nasshe , widow, of Horsham, remits and quit-claims to Thomas Prowde of the same, all demands, both real and personal, to the present time. Dated at London, 6 April, 11 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 150.

Indenture dated at Horsham on the feast of St. Laurence, 2 Hen. V, by which William Stowte of Horsham and Katherine his wife demise to Richard Bradbrugge and Agnes his wife a tenement and lands in the borough of Horsham for their lives, and a croft called Pelynges. MS. Ch. Sussex 151.

Thomas Wodehacche and Leticia his wife grant to John Bradbrugge, Isabell Bradbrugge, and William Stowte, all those lands and tenements in the borough of Horsham called Mascales, which they had by the gift of William Jordan and Thomas Prowte, and which the latter had from Matilda Hewet, formerly wife of Geoffrey Hewet of Horle. Dated at Horsham, 11 August, 2 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 152.

Thomas Proute of Horsham grants to Thomas at Hylle, Robert Tornour, and Thomas Seled, one plot of land called La Denne [in Horsham] lying in the demesne of Earlle Marschal, also another parcel called Wollokes. Dated at Horsham on the feast of the Purification of the Virgin, 3 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 153.

Thomas atte Hill, Robert Tumour, and Thomas Selede demise and confirm to Alice Prowte , late wife of Thomas Prowte of Horsham, all the lands and tenements &c. called Denne in the parish of Horsham, for her life, with licence to dig 'selette stone' in the same; remainder to John Prowte of Herstperpoint, cousin and heir of the said Thomas Prowte. Dated at Horsham, 31 Jan., 10 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 154.

Alice Prowte grants to John Prowte of Hurstperpound all lands and tenements &c. in the parish of Horsham called atte Denne, which lately belonged to Thomas Prowte, to hold for her life; paying to her 33s. 4d. yearly. Dated 4 October, 12 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 155.

John Cook, Richard Cook, Roger Dunstall, and John Duke appoint John Thornden and Robert Sherpenhurst their attorneys to deliver and give seisin to John Bradbrugge , sen., and Thomas Bradbrugge his son, of the lands and tenements in Horsham which they had by gift of John Prowde of Herstperpount. Dated at Lewes, 6 Feb., 29 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 156.

John Prowde of Horstperpound appoints Richard atte Wode of Horstperpound his attorney to deliver to John Cook, Richard Cook, Roger Dunstall, and John Duke, seisin of lands and tenements in Horsham. Dated on the morrow of All Souls, 29 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 157.

John Cook, Richard Cook, Roger Dunstall, and John Duke grant to John Bradbrugge , sen., and Thomas Bradbrugge his son, the lands, tenements, rents, &c. in the parish of Horsham, which they had by feoffment of John Prowde. Dated at Lewes, 6 Feb., 29 Hen. VI. [With four seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 158.

John Prowde of Herstperpound remits to John Bradbrugge , sen., and Thomas Bradbrugge his son, all right and claim in lands, rents, tenements, &c. in Horsham called 'La Denne.' Dated at Horsham, 12 Feb., 29 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 159.

Henry Huse, esq., and Alionora his wife, daughter and heir of John Bradbrigge, deceased, grant to Thomas Polsted and Thomas Jeffrey the manor of Den &c. in Horsham, together with rents and lands in Warnham, Capell, co. Surrey, and Rowsper. Dated 1 2 Dec., 8 Hen. VIII. [Attached is a memorandum of the object of the feoffment, enumerating the various lands conveyed therein.] MS. Ch. Sussex 160a.
Bond given by George Ropkyn of Horsham, butcher, to Henry Husee , esq., for the payment of £60. Dated 7 March, 16 Hen. VIII. MS. Ch. Sussex 161.

Indenture dated 12 Jan., 4 and 5 Philip and Mary, between John Hussee of Cokefeld in the county of Sussex, esq., of the one part, and Averie Michell of Warnham of the other, being a sale of a messuage containing 8 acres to John Hussee by Averie Michell in Horsham, with all the deeds relating to the same. [English.] [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 162.

Bond in 2000 marks given by John Bradbridge of Horsham to save harmless John Hussey of Cuckfield, esq., in all sums he is bound in with the said John Bradbridge to Thomas Gawdye, Raphe Hare, and Anthony Gawdye. Dated 29 Nov., 13 Elizabeth. MS. Ch. Sussex 163.

HURSTPIERPOINT. Henry Elyot, Richard Elyot, John Nore, and Thomas Polyng demise to William Bradbrugge and Alice, daughter of John Preston, lands and tenements in Hurstperpound called 'le Knollond' and 'Lotlond' alias 'Hoblond.' Dated at Hurstperpound, 14 Dec., 5 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Sussex 106.

Charter (indented) made the Monday next before the feast of St. Thomas the apostle, 15 Rich. II, between Thomas de Leghe of the one part, and John Waryn of Penham of the other, witnesseth that Thomas leases to John a field, garden, &c. called Swetericche for 29 years, in the parish of Hurstperpound. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 107.

ITCHINGFELD. William de Mundham grants to John de Findune , son of Philip del Asshe, one field at Hecchingefeld called le Langakeres, paying annually 12d. (c. 1260-70.) [With seal, broken.] MS. Ch. Sussex 87.

John ate Wode of Hechingefeld grants and confirms to John ate Welle and Alice his wife, and the heirs of the said John, two crofts called Medes in Hechingfeld. Dated at Horsham on St. Philip and St. James' day, 25 Ed. I. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 88.

John atte Wode remits and quit-claims to John atte Welle and Alice his wife all right and claim in six fields of land in the parish of Hecchingfeld. Dated at Horsham the Saturday next after the feast of the Epiphany, 33 Ed. I. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 89.

William de Clympesfolde grants to John de Clympesfolde his father the whole of his tenement called Blakelond, with a field and two crofts with a curtilage in Hechingefelde. Dated at Hechingefeld the Sunday next after the feast of St. Richard, bishop, 1 1 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 90.

John de Clympesfolde quit-claims to William his son all right and claim in that tenement called Blakelond, and one field and two crofts and one curtilage, in Hechingfeld. Dated at Hechingefeld the Sunday next before the feast of St. Gregory, pope, n Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 91.

Andrew Peter grants to John de Clymppusfold and Matilda his wife and William their son the whole of that tenement called Blakalond in Hechyngfeld. Dated at Hechyngfeld the Sunday next after the feast of St. Martin, 12 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 92.

Richard, son and heir of John de Bradebrugge, quit-claims to
William his brother all right in the land called Petreslond and in a piece of land called 'Le hyldes', and one garden formerly John atte Wode's in Hechyrigefeld. Dated at Slyndefold the Wednesday next after the feast of St. James, apostle, 13 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 93.

John atte Sonde of the parish of Wernham remits and quit-claims to Roger de Bradebregge and Agnes his wife all right to twenty acres of land and two houses called 'Le hylde' in the parish of Hechyngfelde. Dated at Hechyngfelde the Friday next after the feast of SS. Peter and Paul, 30 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 94.

Richard, son of John de Bradbrige, grants to sir Adam Kareles and Thomas, son of the above Richard, that garden which John de Bradbrige his father obtained from John atte Wode in Hechingfelde. Dated at Slinfolde the Tuesday next after the feast of St. Katharine, virgin, 33 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 95.

Robert Sherpenyst of Hechyngfeld grants to John Bonert and William Merlot all his lands, rents, and tenements in the parish of Hechyngfeld called Sherpenystlond and Sclotherlond, in co. Sussex. Dated at Hechyngfeld the Sunday next after the feast of Corpus Christi, 17 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 96.

Henry Husee , esq., Alvered (Averay) Berewyk, esq., and William Berewyk , esq., demise and confirm to Thomas Shurley , esq., Thomas Saunders , gent., John Staple , gent., John Roberts , gent., Henry Michell, and John Hall, lands, rents, &c. in Hachynfeld, which they had to the use of the said Henry Husee, by the gift of John Hall at the desire of Thomas Holond. Dated 10 May, 22 Hen. VIII. MS. Ch. Sussex 97.
Duplicate of Ch. 97. MS. Ch. Sussex 98.

Indenture dated 1 April, 25 Elizabeth, of sale by John Hussey of Cookefeild, esq., to Stephen Horley of Hitchingefeilde, husbandman, of the manor of Welle in Hechingfeld, paying £20 yearly. [English.] MS. Ch. Sussex 99.

Indenture made 15 June, 33 Elizabeth, reciting the sale by John Hussey of Cuckfield, esq., of the manor in Hitchingfield to one Stephen Horley for an annual rent of £20, dated 10 May, 25 Elizabeth ; also the sale of the said annual rent to Edward Lewknor of Denham, esq., and Thomas Wroth of the Inner Temple, gent., dated 2 Feb., 30 Elizabeth, which said annual rent by the present indenture is regranted to John Hussey by Edward Lewknor and Thomas Wroth. [English.] MS. Ch. Sussex 100.

Indenture dated 15 June, 33 Elizabeth, between Edward Lewkenor of Denham, and Thomas Wroth of the Inner Temple, gent., of the one part, and John Hussey of Cuckfield of the other, concerning a messuage in Hechingfeld. MS. Ch. Sussex 101.

Indenture made 16 May, 24 Charles II, between Henry Husee of Edgerton, co. Kent, esq., and Christian his wife of the one part, and John Michell of Warnham, esq., Edmund Michell of London, draper, and Thomas Middleton of Horsham, gent. of the other part, of the sale of the rent charge of £20 from lands in Hichingfeeld to the said Edmund and Thomas for £400. [English.] MS. Ch. Sussex 102.

LEWES (Priory of). Ralph de Pleiz grants in frankalmoigne to the monks of St. Pancras the church of Iford with its appurtenances and the marl-pit; also he quit-claims to them Kenewardus and all his progeny ; also he grants the churches of Toftes and Syrefort, and whatever he has in the church of Feltewell and the tithes of his lord
ship there, and the land which Geroldus, son of Wlmar, held in Felthewell for which he was accustomed to pay annually 32d., and confirms what his ancestors gave to the said church in frankalmoigne. (c. 1150-60.) MS. Ch. Sussex 165.

FRANCE. Reigne (?) Touchard of Liborne near Bourdeaux appoints Simon du Fryse his attorney to receive in his name all and singular his debts owing for wine in Cales and the marches of the same. Dated 10 December, 1497. MS. Ch. Sussex 82

MICHELHAM (Priory of). Laurence, prior of Michelham, and the convent, acknowledges to have received of Simon Berneval of Sutton, their farmer, 20s. for arrears of rent to this date. Dated at Michelham, 4 Dec., 19 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 167.

MICHELHAM. Marriage settlement between Thomas, duke of Norfolk and Henry, earl of Arundel on the proposed marriage of Thomas Howard, earl of Surrey, cousin and heir apparent of the said duke, to Mary, one of the daughters of the said earl, in which the earl undertakes to convey the manors of Mychelham, Parkgate, Sternfeld, Downask and others in the county of Sussex. 6 April 1 Mary. [English.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 1354

OVINGDEAN. Indenture tripartite, made 31 Jan., 1690, between Harbert Springett of London, gent., son of Herbert Springett of Lewes, of the one part, and John Barksted of London, merchant and Walter Brett of Lewes, grocer of the second part, and John Spence, jun., of Malden of the third part, concerning the manor of Ovingdeane in the county of Sussex. MS. Ch. Sussex 168.

PINKHURST, &c. Simon de la Hulle of Pinkhurst demises and quit-claims to Geoffrey his brother for 40s. the whole of his right and heirship of the land of 'La hale', of the land of Pinkhurst, of the land of la Telthete, of the land of Grelingefolde, and of the mill of La Hyde, and whatsoever shall fall to him by from the inheritance of his father William and his mother Ediwa. c. 1240-1250.) MS. Ch. Sussex 169.

PLAYDON. Edward Wylles of Ria, co. Sussex, yeoman, quitclaims to Philip Chowte, esq., all right &c. in two messuages, gardens, &c. in Playdon at Ceggers hyll . Dated 3 June, 3 Elizabeth. MS. Ch. Sussex 170.

ROBERT'S BRIDGE (Abbey of). Fragment of examinations of certain witnesses in a cause of tithes between the prior and convent of Ledes (?) and the abbey and convent of Robert's Bridge, of the lands and value of this abbey in Lambrehurst. Endorsed: 'contra abbatem de Ponte Roberti'. [c. 1260-70?] MS. Ch. Sussex 171.
RUSPER. William Chich grants to Adam le Banant and Alice his wife one part of his land with a house in the parish of Ruespere, paying annually 12d. (c. 1270-80) MS. Ch. Sussex 172a.

John Newdegate of Newdegate grants to John Bartelot, jun., and Robert Nytember all his lands and tenements in Rowesparre called Westegotewyke. Dated at Rowsparre the Sunday next before the feast of St. Margaret, virgin, 3 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 172b.

SEAFORD. Richard Pegworth , clerk, remits and quit-claims to Simon Bernevale of Seford all actions real and personal against the said Simon to the date of this present writing. Dated at London, 22 January, 31 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 173.

SELEHAM. Philip de Seleham, son and heir of Ralph de Seleham, grants to the hospital of St. John of Jerusalem, in frankalmoigne, a messuage, garden, and the mill of Seleham, with the water, fishery, and two islands, together with another messuage, tenement, and certain other lands in Seleham and Howike, and rights of common. [c. 1200-20] [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 164.

SHIPLEY near HORSHAM. Isabella, late wife of William Herberd, grants to Thomas le Ventre and Joan his wife the whole of
her part of a parcel of land called Bruggreslond in the parish of Sheplee, also a croft &c. in Horsham. Dated at Horsham the Saturday next after the feast of St. Gregory, 42 Ed. III. [With two seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 174.

SLINFOLD, &c. Richard de Climpesfaude and Alice his wife grant to John their son two acres of meadow in the parish of Slindefaude in the meadow called 'Norzlondes med', formerly belonging to Walter de le Strate (c. 1260-70.) [With seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 175.

Richard Climpesfaude grants to John his son the whole of his messuage and garden in the parish of Slindefaude, which he bought of Helewise, the widow of Ralph le Rus. (c. 1270-80.) [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 176.

Richard de la Strode, son and heir of Thomas de la Strode, remits and quit-claims to Oliver de Esseby all right in a piece of land and the mill of La Hyde, about which they had had a dispute, for 14s. 4d.. (c. 1240-50.) [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 177.
Robert de Clympesfolde de Slyndefaude grants to John de Clympesfold his brother the whole of a field which is called 'La Hyde' in the parish of Slyndefaude. (c. 1280-90.) MS. Ch. Sussex 178.

Walter de Penge , son of Walter le Marechal, grants to Oliver de Eslee for the sum of 40s. the half of a mill in the parish of Sclindefaud, viz. at 'La Hyde' at an annual rent of 10s. (c. 1270.) [With fragment of seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 179.

William de la Stroude grants to Joan, daughter of Richard de Climpesfolde, the whole of his land called 'Strodlond' and Roulonde in the parish of Slindefaude, and 5s. annual rent in Wornham, and the field called Hyeluescroft, and i6d. rent and a meadow called New Bridge in Wornham. (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Sussex 180.

John de la Toune, son and heir of Gilbert de la Toune, remits and quit-claims to William, son of Robert de Clympesfaud for 20s. the services due to him from a tenement in Slindefaude. Dated at Slindefaud the Monday on the morrow of Easter, 29 Ed. I. MS. Ch. Sussex 181.

Richard de Clympesfaude grants to John his son two acres of meadow in the parish of Slyndefaude in the meadow called Northlondesmed. (c. 1270-80.) [Apparently a regrant of Ch. 175 after the death of Alice and Mabilia; the witnesses are the same.] MS. Ch. Sussex 182.
Richard, called 'Le Page,' of Slyndefaud, grants to Roger his brother three acres of arable land with buildings thereon in Slyndefaud, paying annually 12d. (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Sussex 183.

Convention dated Easter, 13 Ed. II, between John de Klympesfold of the one part, and William de Ayselye of the other, by which the said John grants to the said William a ditch in Slyndefold. MS. Ch. Sussex 184.

John de Clympesfolde grants to Roger his son 16s. annual rent from a tenement called Tounlond in Slyndefolde, held by Richard Wyldegous, Matilda his wife and Richard his son. Dated at Slyndefold the Saturday next after the feast of St. Stephen, 10 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 185.

John de Clympesfolde grants to Richard Wyldegous and Matilda his wife, for their lives, certain land called Tounyngeslond in Slyndefolde. Dated at Slyndefold the Monday next after the feast of the Nativity B. V. M., 10 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 186.

William de Asshele , son of William de Asshele of Horsham, grants to William
Urry, sen., two water-mills and lands &c. which he had by heirship after the death of his father, at La Hyde in Slindefolde and Warnham. Dated at Warnham the Friday next after the feast of St. Nicholas, bishop, 12 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 187.

Whereas William, son of William de Asshele, granted to William Urry , sen., two mills and their lands in Slindefolde and Warnham, by a charter kept in the hands of Walter de Bonewyk, now the said William de Urry concedes that at the end of four years from the feast of the Annunciation next, the said mills and lands shall revert to the said William de Asshele. Dated at Horsham the Friday next after the feast of St. Nicholas, bp., 12 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 188.

John de Bradebrugg grants to Roger his son four messuages, 25 acres of land, and two acres of meadow in Slyndefold. Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday next after the feast of St. Laurence, 15 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 189.

John de Bradebrugg appoints William de Clympesfold his attorney to put Robert his son in possession of four messuages and 25 acres of land and two acres of meadow in Slyndefold, as in Ch. Sussex 189. Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday next after the feast of St. Laurence, 15 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 190.

Richard, son of John de Bradebrug of Slyndefold, grants and quitclaims to Roger de Bradebrug his brother all right and claim in 4 messuages, 25 acres of land, and 2 acres of meadow in the meadow called Northlongesmed in Slyndefold, also in a meadow called Jeoiezie in Slyndefold. Dated at Slyndefold the Monday after the feast of St. Blasius, 16 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 191.

Roger de Bradebrugg grants to John de Bradebrugg his father the whole of his land called Crokkereslond and a field called Le Hyde in Slyndefold and Warnham. Dated at Slynfold the Sunday next after the feast of St, Lucy the virgin, 16 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 192.

Roger de Bradebrugg grants to John de Bradebrugg his father the whole of his land called Crokkeresland and one field called Le Hyde in Slyndefold and Warnham. Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday next after the feast of St. Lucy, virgin, 16 Ed. III. Counterpart of Ch. 192. MS. Ch. Sussex 193.

John de Bradebrugg remits and quit-claims to Roger de Bradebrugg his son all right which he has in lands and tenements called Crokkereslond and 'Le Hyden' in Slyndefold and Warnham. Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday on the feast of the Nativity of our Lord, 19 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 194.

John Elof of Slyndefold grants to William Elof all his lands and tenements and certain rents of 3s. from .... and 12d. from ... in Slyndefold. Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday after the feast of St. Michael, 24 Ed. III [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 195.

John Elof of Slyndefold remits and quit-claims to William Elof his
brother all right to lands and tenements, &c. in Slinfold and Petteworthe, which he formerly gave his said brother by charter [Ch. 195]. Dated at Slyndefold, 31 May, 26 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 196.

Ida, who was the wife of Thomas le Grete, grants to Roger de Bradebrugg a certain garden and croft in Slyndefold, for the term of her life. Dated at Slyndefold the Saturday next after the feast of St. James the apostle, 26 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 197.

Robert le Coupere of Horsham grants to Roger de Bradebrugge and Agnes his wife one piece of land called 'Le Hyde' in Slyndefold, which he had by the said Roger's gift. Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday next after the feast of St. Thomas, martyr, 27 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 198.

John le Grete grants to sir Henry Tregoz , knt., the reversion of two acres of land and one garden in Slyndfold, which Ida, who was the wife of Thomas le Grete, holds for her life. Dated at Slynfold the Sunday on the octave of the Holy Trinity, 27 Ed. III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 199.

Roger de Bradebrugge of Slyndefolde grants to Robert le Coupere of Horsham one piece of land called 'Le Hyde' in Slyndefolde, which he had by the gift of Edmund de Lenham and Amicia his wife, to hold for the life of the said Amicia. Dated at Bradebrugge the Thursday next before the feast of the Translation of St. Thomas, martyr, 27 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 200.

Indenture dated Thursday next after the feast of St. Martin, 28 Ed. III, by which William de Weston grants to Roger de Bradebrig and Agnes his wife the reversion of 15 acres of land called 'le Hydes' in Slyndefolde, conveyed to them by Robert de Coupere, to hold for the life of Amicia de Lenham; paying to him after the death of the said Amicia ... yearly . MS. Ch. Sussex 201.

Roger le Taillor of Oxedon, chaplain, grants to sir Adam Carles, Richard, son of John de Bradebrugge of Slyndefold, and Thomas, son of Richard, all the lands &c. in Slyndefold and Hechyngfeld which he had by gift of the said Richard. Dated at Slyndfold on the feast of St. Katherine, virgin, 33 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 202.

Joan, relict of Richard la Leche of Harbergh, remits and quitclaims to Roger de Bradbrigg all right in her dower lands &c. in the parish of Slyndfold. Dated at Harberg, 1 August, 36 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 203.

Walter, son and heir of Roger de Bradebrugg, grants and confirms to Richard Bussebrygg , son of John de Bussebrygg, and Joan his wife, the meadow called le Normed in Slyndefold and ... in Horsham, Warnham, and Slyndefold. Dated at Horsham the Friday next after the feast of St. Mark, evang., 4 Rich. II. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 204.

Robert Wygere of Horsham and Richard Heyne , sen., of Wernham, grant to Richard atte Strode of Slyndefold for his life all those lands and tenements which they had of the gift of the said Richard atte Strode, with contingent remainders to Joan his sister, John her son, and ... . Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday next after the feast of the Purification, 2 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 205.

John Wakehurst, John Bonwike, Robert atte Lynde, and Thomas
Larence remit and quit-claim to John Urry de la Rogheye all right in a water-mill &c. in Warnham and Slyndefold, which they lately had by feoffment from him. Dated at Horsham, 14 November, 7 Hen. IV. [With seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 206.

John Urry de la Roghey remits and quit-claims to John Bradebrygge , sen., and John Rumbem , jun., all right &c. in a water-mill called 'Le Hyde mylle,' and lands &c. thereto belonging, in Slyndefold and Warnham. Dated at Slyndefold on the feast of the Nativity of our Lord. 7 Hen. IV. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 207.

John Urry de la Roghey grants to John Bradebrugge , sen., and John Rumbem , jun., of Slyndefold, one mill called le Hydemyll in Slyndefold and Warnham. Dated at Slyndefold on the feast of the Conception of the Virgin, 7 Hen. IV. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 208.

John Corby , clerk, Richard Edward, William Apselee , sen., Bartholomew atte Noore, Roger Cook of Slyndefold, and John Eyloff remit and quit-claim to Henry Eyloff all right in all the lands, tenements, &c. in the parishes of Slyndefold, Byllynghurst, Bradewatere, Somtynge, and Launcynge, which they had lately by feoffment of the said Henry. Dated at Bradewatere on the feast of St. Ambrose, 8 Hen. IV. [With two seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 209.

John, son and heir of Walter Bradbrugge , deceased, of Slyndefold, grants to John Bradbrugge, sen., his uncle, sir Richard Burges, and sir John Ide, chaplains, all his lands and tenements &c. in the county of Sussex, with the reversion of those which would come to him after the death of Isabella his mother. Dated at Slyndefold on the feast of the Assumption, 9 Hen. IV. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 210.

John Wylteshyre, William Cheyne, and Richard Wakehurst appoint John Warnecamp their attorney to receive in their name the third part of a messuage and divers lands &c. in Slyndefold conveyed to them by John Fray, John Speleman, Thomas Rolf, and William Chernell. Dated 16 May, 12 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 211.

John Corby , clerk, and Thomas Ifold, chaplain, remit and quitclaim to Richard Wakehurst, John Waleys, John Bolne, John Arche, John Payn , sen., and John Payn, jun., all their right in lands and tenements called Eylones in Slyndefold, which they lately had from Henry Eyloue. Dated at Bradewatre on the feast of Pentecost, 12 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 212.

John Bradbrugge , sen., and John Rombeme , jun., of Slyndefold grant to Thomas Pylfold of Horsham, sen., and Isabella Bradbrugge, a water-mill called Hydemyll, &c. in Slyndefold and Warnham. Dated at Slyndefold, Ash-Wednesday, 13 Hen. IV. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 213.

Roger Cook remits and quit-claims to Richard Wakehurst, John Waleys, John Bolne, John Arche, John Payn , sen., and John Payn,
jun., all his right in lands, tenements, &c. called Eylones in Slyndefold, which lately belonged to his brother Henry Eylone. Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday next before the feast of St. James, apostle, 13 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 214.

Alice, lately the wife of Henry Eyloue, remits and quitclaims to Richard Wakehurst, John Waleys, John Bolne, John Arche, John Payn, sen., and John Payn, jun., all right in lands and tenements called Eylones in Slyndefold. Dated on the feast of St. Laurence, 13 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 215.

John Eyloue remits and quit-claims to Richard Wakehurst, John Waleys, John Bolnee, John Arche, John Payn, sen., and John Payn, jun., all right in lands and tenements &c. called Eylones in Slyndefold, which lately belonged to his brother Henry Eylone. Dated at Slyndefold the Sunday next before the feast of St. James, apostle, 13 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 216.

Richard Bussebrugge remits and quit-claims to John Bradbrugge , son of Walter Bradbrugge, all right in lands, rents, &c. in Horsham, Warnham, and Slynfold, which Roger Bradbrugge, grandfather of the said John, gave to his daughter Joan, late wife of the said Richard. Dated at Slyndefold the Thursday on the morrow of the Nativity of the Virgin Mary, 5 Hen. V. MS. Ch. Sussex 217.

John Rumbem of Slyndefold appoints Thomas atte Hull of Neubrugge his attorney to give to John Bradbrugg, Thomas atte Hull of Horsham, and William Rownor seisin of his lands and tenements in Slyndefold and Byllyngehurst. Dated the Monday next before the feast of the Annunciation, 6 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 218.

John Bradbregge appoints John Hayne his attorney to deliver to Richard Burgeys, vicar of Warnham, and others, possession of all those his lands and tenements in Slyndefold, Warneham, and Horsham called Tounlond. Dated 10 November, 8 Hen. V. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 219.

John Rumbem of Slyndefold grants to John Bradbrugge, Thomas atte Hull of Horsham, and William Rownor, all lands, tenements, &c. in Slyndefold and Byllynghurst. Dated at le Vyolotte the Monday next before the feast of the Annunciation of the Blessed Virgin, 6 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 220.

Richard Wakehurst, John Bolne, John Waleys, and John Arche remit and quit-claim to John Payn of Cokefelde all right in lands, tenements, &c. called Eylones in Slyndefold. Dated at Slyndefold on the feast of the Nativity of our Lord, 7 Hen. VI. [With two seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 221.

John Payn of Cokefeld grants to Richard Dalyngregge, esq., William Sydeny, jun., John Bartelot, and John Bolne, all the lands, tenements, &c. in Cokefeld, whch he had lately from John Pyk, in exchange for other lands &c. in Slyndefold. Dated at Cokefeld, 24 Sept., 9 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 222.

John Payn of Cokefeld appoints John Chaloner his attorney to deliver seisin to Richard Dalyngregge, esq., William Sydeny, jun., John Bartelot, and John Bolne of lands in Cokefeld, which he had in exchange for other lands in Slyndefold. Dated 24 Sept., 9 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 223.

John Blake of Slyndefold grants to John Blake his son the whole of his tenement and garden in Slyndefold, with contingent remainders to John's brother Thomas and sisters Rosa and Joan. Dated at Slyndefold, 30 Sept., 10 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 224.

John Nore, Walter Fust, and John Thornden demise to Thomas Bradbrygge, son and heir of John Bradbrygge, and Isabella, wife of the said Thomas, all lands &c. called 'Le Tounelond' in Slyndefold, and also all lands, tenements, &c., which were Robert Bonette's in Capelle co. Surrey and the parcels of land called Halredene and Suthredene in Rusparre co. Sussex. Dated 6 Feb., 24 Hen. VI. [With seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 225.

John Bradbrugge grants to Walter Fust, Walter Okynden, John Wikyng, John Thornden, and William Nye, all lands, services, &c. which he has in Slyndefold, Warnham, Rowsperre, Horsham, Hechyngfeld, Shepele, and Hurstperpound. Dated at Slyndefold, 14 June, 29 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 226.

Thomas Bradbrugge of Slyndfold grants to John Wykyng, Henry Reperose, Richard Waller, John Standebrugge, and Robert Sharpenliurst, all his lands &c. in the parishes of Hechyngfeld, Slyndfold, and Horsham. Dated at Slyndfold, 12 January, 39 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 227.

Isabella, lately wife of John atte Woode of Cicestre, grants to Joan Ropkyns of Horsham her sister all lands and tenements which she has in Slynfold, paying to her 6s. 8d. yearly during her life. Dated at Slynfold, 5 Sept., 19 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 228.

John Hallend grants to Thomas Nore, John Hall, John Nye, and Richard Potter, lands, rents, &c. called 'Coliers' in the parish of Slindefolde and Hechyngfeld. Dated 10 August, 1 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Sussex 229.
Joan Ropkyns of Horesham, widow, grants to Walter Bradbryge and Nicholas Hurste the whole of her lands and tenements in Sclyndefold. Dated at Horesham, 30 July, 15 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Sussex 230.
Recovery at Westminster by Edward Leukenore, esq., and Richard Foys, against Henry Neudegate and Joan his wife, of lands and woods in Slynfold, .... Hilary Term, 16 Henry VII. MS. Ch. Sussex 231.

John Bole, one of the heirs of William Bartelote, viz. son of Joan sister of the said William, sells to John Caryll, John Michell of Stamerham, Richard Michell, and Richard Foys, all those lands and tenements in Slynfold called 'Feldlonds' which were William Bertelotes's Dated 3 July, 16 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Sussex 232.

Henry Neudegate and Joan his wife remit and quit-claim to Edward Leukenore, esq., and Richard Foys, all right in lands and rents in Slynfold. Dated 7 April, 18 Hen. VII [As in Ch. 231]. MS. Ch. Sussex 233.
Probate of the will of John Bradbrige, granted by the court of the archbishop of Canterbury to Agnes his relict and executrix. Dated n Dec., 1503, at Lamehith. MS. Ch. Sussex 234.

Indenture of agreement made 7 September, 7 Hen. VIII, between Alverey Barewyk, esq., and Agnes his wife of the one part, and Henry Husee
and Alionore his wife, granddaughter of Thomas Bradbrigge, of the other part, concerning lands in Slinfold, Hechingfeld, Horsham, &c., for restoration to the said Alienore as her lawful inheritance. [English.] MS. Ch. Sussex 235.

Indenture dated 22 June, 9 Hen. VIII, between Henry Huse, esq., and Elienor his wife, Walter Bradbrigg and Matilda his wife, and Richard Bradbrigg and Dionisia his wife of the one part, and John Baker and Christopher Hales of the other, concerning a fine sued out in the king's court for division of lands in Slinfold, Warnham, and Hechingfeld. [With seal.] [English] MS. Ch. Sussex 236.
Duplicate of Ch. 236. MS. Ch. Sussex 237.

Indenture dated 7 March, 16 Hen. VIII, by which George Ropkyn of Horsham, butcher, sells to Henry Husey of Slinfold, esquire certain lands and hereditaments in Slynfold, with all the deeds relating to the same. [English.] MS. Ch. Sussex 238.

Indenture made 18 March, 16 Hen. VIII, by which Henry Husee of Slynfold, esq., covenants and grants by these presents to George Ropkyn of Horsham, that if before the Annunciation of the B.V. M., 1531, the said George can re-purchase with his own money, not borrowed, certain lands &c. in Slynfold that he had previously sold to the said Henry, then the said Henry shall sell the same to the said George for £44, and costs and charges; reserving future right of pre-emption to Henry Husee if again sold. [English.] MS. Ch. Sussex 239.

George Ropkyn of Horsham, butcher, confirms to John Coupar, sen., of Slynfold, yeoman, and Thomas Myles of Horsham, yeoman, all his messuages, lands, and tenements situated in the parish of Slynfold, to hold to the use of Henry Husee, esquire. Dated 12 March, 16 Hen. VIII. MS. Ch. Sussex 240.

Recovery dated 18 May, 17 Hen. VIII, between Henry Husee, Alvered Barwyk, esq., Robert Richardson and Richard Mournesale, against John Couper, sen., and Thomas Myles, concerning one messuage and lands in Slyndefold. [With seal pro brevibus coram justiciariis.] MS. Ch. Sussex 241.

John Caryll, John Michell of Stamerham, Richard Michell, and Richard Foys demise and confirm to Thomas Fenys, esq., Edward Lewkenore, esq., Edward Lewkenore his son, John Bradbrigg and Ann his wife, John Lee of Adyngton, Nicholas Lee his son, John Ernley, John Goryng, and Richard Broke, lands and tenements in Slynfold called Feldlong, which formerly were William Bertelote's. Dated 21 October, 17 Hen. VII. [With seals and signatures of the grantors.] MS. Ch. Sussex 242.

John Bole, one of the heirs of William Bartelote, namely the son of Joan sister to the aforesaid William, and John Weller remit and quit-claim to John Caryll, John Michell of Stamerham, Richard Michell, and Richard Foys, all right in lands &c. in Slynfold called Feldlond. Dated 18 Oct., 17 Hen. VII. [With two seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 243.

Final concord, dated on the octave of St. Michael, 18 Hen. VIII, between Henry Husee, Alvered Berwyk, Robert Richardson, and Richard Mourneshale, plaintiffs, and George Ropkyn, defendant, concerning a messuage and lands in Slinfold, for which £40 were paid to the latter. MS. Ch. Sussex 244.

Indenture dated 8 May, 20 Hen. VIII, by which William Tredcrofte ,
of the parish of Byllyngshurst, co. Sussex, yeoman, sells to Henry Husse lands &c. in Slinfold called the Combe land, with all the deeds relating to the same, for £30. [English] MS. Ch. Sussex 245.

Henry Husee, esq., Alvered Berewyk, esq., Henry Robertys, esq., Henry Michell, John West, and Henry Voyce demise and confirm to Thomas Shurley, esq., Thomas Saunders, gent., John Staple, gent., John Kobertys, gent., and John Halle, jun., a messuage and lands in Slynfold, to the use of the said Henry Husee and his heirs; which they had by fine of William Tredecroft. Dated 10 May, 22 Hen. VIII. [With two seals and signatures.] MS. Ch. Sussex 247.
Duplicate of Ch. 247. [With five seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 248.

Henry Husee, esq., Alvered Berewyk, esq., Robert Richardson, and Richard Mourneshale confirm to Thomas Shurley, esq., .Thomas Saunders, gent., John Staple, gent., John Robertys, gent., Henry Michell, and John Hall, jun., one messuage and lands in Slyndefold, which they recovered from John Couper and Thomas Mylys. Dated 10 May, 22 Hen. VIII. MS. Ch. Sussex 249.

William Tredcroft of Byllynggyshurst, yeoman, grants to Alvered Barwyke, esq., Henry Husse, esq., Henry Roberts, gent., Henry Michell, John West, and Henry Foys, lands, rents, &c. in the parish of Slinfold called le Combeland. Dated 12 August, 20 Hen. VIII. MS. Ch. Sussex 250.

Richard Blake of Terryng, butcher, son and heir of Richard Blake of Horsham, deceased, sells to Henry Husee, John Staple, John West, and Walter Stengar, land and a garden in Slynfold. Dated 26 Sept., 24 Hen. VIII. MS. Ch. Sussex 251.

Indenture dated 1 September, 34 Hen. VIII, by which Thomas Sanders sells to Harry Husse, of Slynfold, gent., lands, rents, &c. in Slinfold and Riggewike, for £12 and a yearly rent of ... to the said Thomas for his life, with lands in Abinger, Okley, and the Ewherst in Surrey. [English]. MS. Ch. Sussex 252.

Indenture made 2 Jan., 17 Elizabeth, between John Hussey of Paynes in Cokefeld of one part, and William Stapley of Highsted and John Ward of the Inner Temple of the other part, concerning a writ of disseisin to enable him to sell the manor of Wells in the parishes of Slinfold, Hechingfeld and Warnham. MS. Ch. Sussex 253.

Recovery dated 12 Feb., 17 Elizabeth, by which William Stapley and John Warde have seisin of the manor of Well in co. Sussex, against John Hussey, gent. , in pursuance of the preceding indenture [Ch. Sussex 253]MS. Ch. Sussex 254.

Indenture dated 16 Jan., 18 Elizabeth, between John Hussee of Cuckfield, co. Sussex, esq., of the one part, and Robert Knight of Slyndefold, yeoman, of the other part, lease of a messuage &c. in Slindefold called Combeland for 60 years at an annual rent of £5.. [English] [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 255.

Final concord, dated Trinity Term, 19 James I, between Henry Thompson, esq., und Robert Thompson, gent., of one part, and Jane Husee and George Husee, esq., of the other, concerning lands &c. in Slynfold, Warnham and Horsham, for which £240 are paid to the said Jane and George. MS. Ch. Sussex 256.

Indenture dated 20 May, 19 James I, between Jane Hussee of Wye, co. Kent, widow, late wife of George Hussee of Peasemersh, esq., and George Hussee of Wye his son and heir of the one part, and Henry
Thompson of Royton in the parish of Lenhem, Kent, esq., and Robert Thompson of his son and heir of the other part, witnesseth that the said George Hussey makes over certain lands and tenements in Slinfold and Warnham to Mary his now wife, daughter of the said Henry Thompson as her marriage settlement, in consideration of having received £700 and her dowry. [English] MS. Ch. Sussex 257.

Indenture dated 22 July, 19 James I, between George Hussee of Wye of one part, and Henry Thompson of Royton of the other part, for settlement of lands in Slinfold on George Hussee and Mary his wife. [English]MS. Ch. Sussex 258.

Indenture dated 29 April, 7 Charles I, between Ralph Cowper of Slinfold, esq., executor of the will of Edward Cowper, deceased, and Judith Naldrett of Radgwicke, executrix of the will of John Naldrett, deceased, gent., of one part, and George Hussey of Boughton Mun..chelston, Kent, esquire, and Anthony Hussey of ...combe, Kent, gent., of the other part, concerning lands in Slinfold sold to the latter or £240. [English] MS. Ch. Sussex 259.

Dispensation granted to Walter Jones, S.T.B., to hold the rectory and vicarage of Slingfield together with the rectory of Ernly cum Almodington for the term of his life. Dated at Oxford, 13 Nov., 19 Charles I. MS. Ch. Sussex 260.

SNEYLHAM. Robert, son of Henry Walkelyn of Paulynescraye co. Kent, grants to John de Pydyngton of co. Buckingham and Margery his wife the whole of the manor of Sneylham in co. Sussex, which he had by feoffment of the said Margery; with remainders to Robert son of Gervase Alarick, and to the heirs of the said John. Dated at Gestlyngg, 15 July, 17 Ed. III. [With seal.]
MS. Ch. Sussex 261.

STEYNING. Robert le Proo grants to Robert de Effingetun, merchant, and Agnes his wife, for their service and 26s., the whole of his land which is called 'la Dene' which lies on the north part of the land of Alice Shereschinges, and on the south of the king's way which leads from Steninges towards Polebererer(?). (c. 1240-50.) [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 262.

John Frensch of Stenyng, co. Sussex, grants to ..., late wife of John Frensch of Midedhurst, an annual rent of 6s. 8d. from his .... in Stenyng. Dated at Stenyng, 4 Oct., .. Hen. VI. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 263.

SULLINGTON. Joan Gardener of Thakham, widow, remits and quit-claims to John, the chaplain of the Blessed Mary of Thakham, Joan, wife of Thomas Wanlyng and John their son, all her right in two fields of land in Sullyngton, as is expressed in a certain charter of feoffment of John Gardener her late husband. Dated at Sullyngton the Saturday next before the Epiphany, 17 Rich. [II]. MS. Ch. Sussex 264.

RUSPER. Thomas Blast of Craule, John Aysmygth, Hugh Stylers, and Robert Bonet of the parish of Rouspar grant to Isabella, wife of Walter Bradbrugge, and Joan, daughter of Thomas le Vanter, lately deceased, 2 parts of all the lands &c. of the said Thomas in the county of Sussex, and a reversion of the other 3rd part now held by Matilda, his relict. Dated at Rousparre the Saturday next before feast of St Michael, 15 Rich. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 265.

Robert Bonet of Rousparre in Sussex grants to John Braclbrigg, John Gyles, William Synggere, clerks, and Richard Forester, all his lands and tenements &c. in Sussex and Surrey. Dated at Rousparre the Sunday next after the feast of the Exaltation of the Cross, 7 Hen. V. MS. Ch. Sussex 266.

Certificate from Walter Urry and John Broutecotte to John Courtehopp and Thomas Ryott, collectors of a tenth granted by Parliament, that they have exonerated Will ... de Sefford from payment of 48s. 4d. of an old crown rent. Dated 1 June, 14 Hen. VI. [Partly effaced.] MS. Ch. Sussex 267.

THAKEHAM and SULLINGTON. Stephen atte Broke of Thakham and Isabella his wife grant to Patric Grene, rector of Thakham, John Clerk, and Nicholas Attewode, all their lands and tenements in the parishes of Thakham and Sullyngton. Dated at Thakham, 22 April, 11 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 268.

Power of attorney of Stephen atte Broke and Isabella his wife given to Thomas Capelayn, to deliver to Patric Grene, rector of Thakham, John Clerk, and Nicholas Attewode, seisin of their lands in the parishes of Thakham and Sullyngton. Dated at Thakham, 23 April, 11 Henry VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 269.

WADHURST. Fragment of a charter by which William Rympynden grants to William Benett and Mariona his wife a messuage and certain land in ... Dated at Wadehurst the Friday next after the feast of . . . . 19 Hen. VI. [Fragment of the same deed as MS. Ch. Sussex 240b] MS. Ch. Sussex 270.

William Rympynden grants to [William Benett] and ... his wife, daughter of Thomas Hellys of Brenchysle in Kent, one messuage [called] Bokelyngge in the parish of Wadeherst with 50 acres of land, 8 acres of meadow ... which he had by gift of 'predicti' William Benett .... [Fragment of the same deed as Ch. Sussex 270, dated 19 Hen. VI] MS. Ch. Sussex 240b.

WALDRON. Roger de Bulesham grants to Robert de Blachinton, clerk, the whole land of Dunnele and the whole of the wood of Rokingeherst in Walderne which tenements William de Crotteberghe formerly bought of John Chynne and afterward Thomas . (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Sussex 271.
WARNHAM, &c. Richard le Crockere grants to Oliver de Essely for 16s. one part of his land in the parish of Wernham, paying yearly half a pound of cummin. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Sussex 272.

Sir John de Polyngefaude, kt., grants to Henry de la Felde and Joan his wife and their heirs, for 100s., 6s. 8d. annual rent which William de Asshelye annually paid for a watermill in Wernham and Slyndefolde, ... a rent of half a pound of cummin paid by the said William for a tenement at la Hidmulle, which the grantor had from Richard la Porter. (c. 1280-90.) [With seal, of arms, broken.] MS. Ch. Sussex 273.

Richard le Crockere grants to Oliver de Assely, for 16s. all his right and claim to half a pound of cummin which the said Oliver was accustomed to pay him for land in Wernham. (c. 1260-70.) [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 274.

Richard de la Felde grants to William de la Strode 5s. annual rent which he was accustomed to receive of Richard le Potir for a tenement in Wornham, also grants a meadow in the same parish called the meadows of Newbridge, (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 275.

Joan de la Strode, daughter of Richard de Climpesfaude grants to Geoffrey de la Felde the whole of her tenement of Strode and of Felde which William de la Strode gave her in heirship. (c. 1280-90.) MS. Ch. Sussex 276.

Richard, son of Henry atte Feld of Slindefold, remits and quit-claims
to John de Bradebrugge all right in the field called Bolnescroft and the land of Crockereslond in the parish of Wernham. Dated at Slindefold the Monday on the feast of the Seven Brothers, 12 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 277.

Convention dated Easter, 13 Ed. II, between John de Klympesfold of the one part, and William de Asselye of the other, by which the said John grants to the said William one parcel of land in Wernham from the field called Herstfeld, with agreements about maintenance and the making . [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 278.

Warnham Richard le Thecchen of Wernham remits and quit-claims to Thomas atte Hecche and William his son of the same village, all right in 1d. of annual rent from a field called 'Le Hok.' (c. 1280-1290.) [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 279.

William, son of Richard atte Lyth of Wernham, remits and quitclaims all right in two fields of land called 'Le Hokes' in Wernham to Thomas atte Hache which the latter later acquired from the said Richard. Dated at Wernham the Sunday next before the feast of the Translation of St. Thomas, martyr, 2 Ed. III. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 280.

Similar release from Alice, who was the wife of Richard atte Lythe of Wernham, to Thomas atte Hacche and William his son, of her third part of the two fields called 'La Hokes' in Wernham. Dated at Wernham the Sunday next after the Epiphany, 4 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 281.

John de Clymppusfolde remits and quit-claims to Roger his son all right in the field with meadow and grove adjacent called Belvescroft in the parish of Wernham. Dated at Wernham 'in campo predicto' the Sunday next after the feast of the Annunciation, 5 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 282.

William Esschelye, sen., grants to William Urri, sen., for a sum of money his mills called 'Hydemullen' in the parishes of Wernham and Sleyndefold, and two crofts and two meadows lying in the same parishes. Dated at Wernham the Wednesday before the feast of St. Hilary, 7 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 283.

John de Bradebrugge' grants to Roger his son the whole of his land called Crokkereslond in Warnham, and 9s. annual rent from a meadow called Brugmed in the same village. Dated at Warnham the Sunday next after the feast of St. Matthew the apostle, 16 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 284.

Warnham Richard, son of John de Bradbrugge, remits and quit-claims to Roger his brother all right in land called Crokkereslond, and also in 9s. of rent. Dated at Warnham the Wednesday next after the feast of St. Matthew the apostle, 16 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 285.
Richard Geffray of Warnham grants to Joan his daughter one field called 'le Rude' containing eight acres in Warnham. Dated at Warnham, 7 December, 6 Hen. IV. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 286.

Joan Geffray, daughter of Richard Geffray of Warnham, grants to
William Erl and Richard Rikeman one parcel of land called les Northcroftes and 2s. of rent from the land called Wardes, and 7d. of rent from the garden of William Tannere, and one field called 'Le Rude' in Warnham. Dated at Warnham the Sunday next after the feast of the Nativity of St. John the Baptist, 3 Hen. V. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 287.

William Hayne of Warnham grants to John Bradbrugge, Stephen Sloghterford, and Richard Ede all his lands and tenements in the parish of Warnham. Dated at Warnham, 1 June, 11 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 288.

John Cok of Wernham grants to Stephen Sloghterford, Richard Ede, Philip May, and John Roser the whole of the land called les Northcroftes in Wernham and 2s. of rent from the land called Wardes and 7d of rent from the garden of Thomas Tannere. Dated at Wernham, 20 May, 12 Hen. VI. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 289.

William Holden, clerk, son and heir of Matilda Holden, one daughter and heir of Richard Geffray, and Thomas Akesbourne, son and heir of Alice Bottyng, her other daughter and heir of Richard Geffray, remit and quit-claim to Stephen Sloghterford, Richard Ede, Philip May, and John Roser all right in a parcel of land called Northcroftes in Warnham, 2s. of annual rent from land called Wardes and 7d. from a garden of Thomas Tanner, all which they had by grant of John Cok. Dated at Warnham, 31 July, 17 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 290.

John Cok of Warnham remits and quit-claims to Stephen Sloghterford, Richard Ede, Philip May, and John Roser all right in that parcel of land called 'lez Northcroftez' in Warnham, and in the rents of 2s. and 7d as above [Ch. 290]. Dated at Warnham, 20 Oct., 19 Hen. VI. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 291.

Stephen Sloghterford, Richard Ede, William atte Clouse, Philip May, and John Roser grant to John Cok and Margaret his wife the whole of that land called 'Le Lyonnez' in Warnham, and the field called le Rude and a road to the field through the middle of the field called Puttefeld. Dated at Warnham, 28 October, 19 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 292.

Stephen Sloghterford, Richard Ede, Philip May, and John Roser grant to John Cok of Warnham that parcel of land called 'Les Northcroftes' in the parish of Warnham, and 2s. annual rent from land called 'Wardes' and 7d. from a garden of Thomas Tanner in Warnham. Dated at Warnham, 20 December, 19 Hen, VI. [counterpart of Ch. Sussex 295] MS. Ch. Sussex 293.

John Cok of Warnham retorns to Walter Fust and John Bradbrugge the lands and rent in Warnham granted to him for his life, the reversion of which would come to them on his death. Dated at Warnham, 20 Dec., 19 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 294.

Stephen Sloghterford, Richard Ede, Philip May, and John Roser grant to John Cok of Warnham the whole of that parcel of land called 'lez Northecroftes' in the parish of Warnham. Dated at Warnham, 20 December, 19 Hen. VI. [counterpart of Ch. Sussex 293] MS. Ch. Sussex 295.

Richard Ede and William atte Vycories remit and quit-claim to Hugh Thecchere all their right &c. in a parcel of ground in Warnham called 'Lez Hookes.' Dated at Warnham, 14 April, 21 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 296.

Hugh Thecchere of Warnham grants to John Bradbrugge, Walter
Fust, and Richard Ede the whole of that parcel of land in Warnham called 'Lez Hookes.' Dated at Warnham, 15 April, 21 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 297.

William Rykeman, son of Richard Rykeman, deceased, confirms to Walter Fust, John Bradbrugge, and Thomas Bradbrugge one parcel of land called 'Les Northcroftes' lying in Warnham, 2s. of rent from land called Wardes, and 7d. from a garden of William Tanner. Dated at Warnham, 26 October, 28 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 298.

Alice Bottyng, daughter of Richard Geffray, grants to Walter Fust, John Bradbrugge, and Thomas Bradbrugg the parcel of land called 'les Northcroftes' in Warnham, and rents (as above, Ch. 298). Dated at Warnham, 27 October, 28 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 299.

Alice Bottyng, daughter of Richard Geffray, remits and quit-claims to Walter Fust, John Bradbrugge, and Thomas Bradbrugge all right in the parcel of land called 'les Northcroftes' in Warnham, &c. Dated at Warnham, 28 October, 28 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 300.
Agnes Nye appoints Thomas Bradbrugge her attorney to receive in her name certain lands &c. in Warnham, called Randolfez and 'Le Esthowse' and Childes. Dated 17 April, 8 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 301.

Thomas Covert, Richard Waller, Robert Sharpenherst, and Walter Tykeregge demise to Agnes Nye, late the wife of William Nye, for her life, all the lands and tenements &c. in Warnham called Randolfes and le Esthowse and Childes, which they lately had from her. Dated at Warnham, 17 April, 8 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 302.

Thomas Covert, Richard Waller, Robert Sharpenherd, and Walter Tykeregge demise to Thomas Nye and Joan his wife all their lands <c in the parish of Warnham (as above), which they had by gift of Agnes Nye, sister and heir of John Randolf. Dated at Warnham, 19 April, 8 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 303.

John Goryng, Thomas Convert, John Okendene, Stephen Combe, and Thomas Mauncell appoint John Nore their attorney to give full seisin of and in a tenement called Bradbrigge, and lands &c. to the same , in Warnham, also lands in Hechyngfeld, Horsham, Rowsparre, &c. , to John Bradbrigge. Dated 16 October, 2 Hen. VII. [With 4 seals.] MS. Ch. Sussex 304.

John Goring, Thomas Covert, John Okenden, Stephen Comber, and Thomas Mauncell, feoffees of lands of Thomas Bradbrigge, deceased, confirm to John Bradbrigge, son and heir of the above, land &c. in Warnham, Echyngfeld, Horsham and Rowspere. Dated 16 October, 2 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Sussex 305.

Hugh Thecchere of Warnham remits and quit-claims to John Bradbrugge, Walter Fust, and Richard Ede all right and claim in that parcel of ground in Warnham called 'Lez Hookes.' Dated at Warnham, 12 June, 21 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 306.

Walter Bradbrigge and Richard Bradbrigge, sons of Thomas Bradbrigge, quit-claim to Henry Huse and Alianor his wife, lands in Warnham, Slinfold, Hechingfeld, Horsham, &c., reciting previous. Dated 14 November, 8 Hen. VIII. (see 160) MS. Ch. Sussex 160b .

Henry Husee, esq., and Alianora his wife grant to Alvered Berewyk, esq., and Agnes his wife, John Hales, John Chauncy, Christopher Hales, William Pratt, John Baker, and Robert Richardson, the tenement called Bradbrygges, and other lands, &c. in Warnham, Echynfeld, Horsham, Capelle in Surrey, Slinfold, and Rousparre. Dated 17 November, 8 Henry VIII. MS. Ch. Sussex 308.

Indenture made 18 Jan., 1644, by which George Husee of Egerton, co. Kent, esq., undertakes to levy a fine 'sur cognizance de droit come ceo,' &c., unto Anthony Husee of Harrietsham, of and all singular the lands &c. in Warnham, Slynfold, and Horsham. [English] MS. Ch. Sussex 310.

WARNHAM, SLYNDEFOLD, HECHINGFELD, and HORSHAM. 'A rentall of such lands as are conteyned wythyn thys decre whych ys mystres Brygett Hussey's joynter.' [A list of lands and tenements in the above places, separated from another document to which it refers.] MS. Ch. Sussex 309.

WESTDENE. A commission from John, bp. of Chichester, for annexing two houses in the decayed parish of Excet of which the church is in ruins, to the adjoining parish of Westdene, at the instance of Thomas Mathewe, vicar of Excet, and John Oxynford, rector of Westdene. Dated in the Canons' Close, Chichester 10 April, 1460. MS. Ch. Sussex 311.
WEYERED. The will of Joane Pope, widow of Robert Pope of Weybred, co. Suffolk, dated 24 June, 16 Charles I, 1640. [On paper.] [Original.] MS. Ch. Sussex 312.
Subsequent will of Joane Pope, widow of Robert Pope of Weybred, co. Sussex, dated 2 Dec., 1644. [Original, no probate.] [On paper.] MS. Ch. Sussex 313.

WINCHELSEY. Fragment of a charter by which William Eppelffeld and William Pryns of Winchelse remit and quit-claim to Agnes, who was the wife of Gervase Loueroun, all right in .... in the village of Wynchelse. Dated at 18 Rich. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 314.

BISHOPSTON (Manor of). Rental renovatum per certos homines juratos, et postea examinatum per sacramentum omnium tenencium in pleno hallio ibidem tento anno regni regis Henrici sexti XXI [Rental of the manor of Bishopston, taken 21 Henry VI.] 21 Hen. VI. MS. Rolls Sussex 1.

CHICHESTER (Diocese of). Account of the tenths due to the king for one year ending at Christmas 1685, rendered by John Lake, bp. of Chichester, collector, through Nathaniel Powell, sub-collector, his deputy. MS. Rolls Sussex 2.

STONEHAM [in South Malling]. Rolls of 11 membranes, containing the rolls of the Hallmote of the manor of Stoneham, comprising the following places, Southeram, Norlington, Wellingham, Middeham, and Ashton, from 29 Nov. the 30th to 30 Sept. the 39th year of Henry VI. MS. Rolls Sussex 3.

ABBEY OF BEIGHAM. BEIGHAM. Ela de Sakeville, daughter of Ralph de Dene, widow, confirms the grants of her father and brother &c. to the abbey of Otteham with license to transfer the abbey to Be[igham called Beaulieu]. [Mutilated.] (1200-1210.) The grant was confirmed by King John in 1210-11. MS. Ch. Sussex 7a.
Charter by which .... grants to the abbot and convent of Beigham [Fragment and effaced.] MS. Ch. Sussex 8.

Michael de Tonge grants to the church of St. Mary of Begeham, in frankalmoigne, the whole of his land of Tonge, paying annually to him and his heirs 1d. (c. 1200-10.) [confirmed by King John in 1210-1211] MS. Ch. Sussex 9.

Matilda de Bendestede, widow, grants to the abbot and convent of Begeham, in frankalmoigne, .... shillings and fourpence which John de .... Kerigge (?) was accustomed annually to pay her from a tenement, (c. 1230-40.) [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 11.
Mutilated and almost entirely effaced bull of Pope Alexander the MS. Ch. Sussex 13.

(Endorsement) Simon Payer of the parish of Fristhon grants to the abbot and canons of St. Mary, Begeham, in frankalmoigne, .... shillings of annual rent which Andrew de Croichuke (?) was accustomed to pay to him .... (c. 1250-60.) [Mutilated and in part illegible.] MS. Ch. Sussex 15.

John, called the young "Juvenis", of Hellingelie, and Alice his wife, daughter of J ... de Hellingelie grant and quit-claim to the abbey of Begham all their right in 1 ½lb. of pepper annual rent. (c. 1260-70.) [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 17.
Fragment of an ecclesiastical mandate, dated Nones of June, 1282. MS. Ch. Sussex 19.
Fragment of a grant from [the abbot and convent of Beigham?] to ... de Borham, dated "in domo nostro ... 3 ..." 1 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 22b.
Fragment, being the concluding portion of a lease of a manor and rectory from the abbey to William Weston, dated on the feast of St. Michael, archangel, 1419, 7 Hen. V. MS. Ch. Sussex 23.
Fragment of a writ of King Hen. VI respecing the abbot and convent of Beigham and the Premonstratensian order. [In great part effaced.] MS. Ch. Sussex 25.
Thomas, the abbot, and convent of Begham grant to Robert .... certain lands for .... years at an annual rent of .... Dated .... 37 Hen. VI. [Mutilated and in part effaced.]. MS. Ch. Sussex 27.

BOREHAM, [in Warthing, Sussex]. Convention made on the feast of St. Michael, 22 Rich. II., between Robert Frendesbury, abbot of ..... and Richard Coupere, draper of Borham, and Joan his wife, being a demise of a tenement in Borham called Scottes tenement, formerly Will Scottes and antoher called Degheres tenement, formerly John Degheres, for 100 years at an annual rent of 2s. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 28b.

BROKELE. Walter, bp. of Rochester, confirms the gift of Juliana the countess, and Michael de Torneham her seneschal, of land &c. for the support of the canons of Wellesford at Brokele in frankalmoigne. c. 1180 [Walter, bp. of Rochester, 1147-1183.] MS. Ch. Sussex 3.

DENE. Robert de Dene, son of Sibilla de Dene, grants to the church of Begham, in frankalmoigne, 20s. of annual rent in the village of Dene, also half a mark of rent in Mereshale, and the advowson of the church of Westdene. (c. 1240-50) [With seal.] MS. Ch. Sussex 7b.

HAILSHAM. William de Bugel grants to the canons of Otteham, in frankalmoigne, for eight marks, the whole of his land in the marsh lying between Pevenese and Heilesham of the fee of Rikewurd of Hellingel', rendering yearly half a pound of pepper. [Mutilated.] (c. 1190-1200.) [Printed in the Monasticon, VI, 915.] MS. Ch. Sussex 1.

Convention between the abbot and convent of Begeham of one part, and Ranaulf le Rudde of the other, by which the said Ranaulf grants to the said abbot and convent the land which Thomas of the Marsh held of him, and
granges .... in exchange for 13 acres one rood of land .... (c. 1210-20.) In great part illegible. MS. Ch. Sussex 5.

Herbert de Burgherse grants to Richard the sompner (sumonitori} of Leawes, for his service, 12 acres of land in the marsh of Heilesham, paying annually for the same the third part of one half-mark, and at Christmas, the third part of one pound of pepper and one pound of cummin. For this donation the said Richard gave 23 marks of silver, (c. 1220-30.) MS. Ch. Sussex 6a.
HELLINGLEY. Laurence, the abbot and convent of Begham demise to Thomas le Bret and Isabel his wife .... in the village of Hellingeleghes . . . . (c. 1280-90.) [A fragment.] MS. Ch. Sussex 18.

Indenture by which John the abbot and convent of Beghame demise to John Twytte Richard and John Twytte 5 pieces of land in Hellinglegh, for 89 years they paying annually to the said abbot and convent 22s. Dated feast of St Michael, 9 Hen. V [Mutilated and in part illegible.] MS. Ch. Sussex 24.

KECHENHAM. Adam, son of Edric of West Kechenham, remits and quit-claims to the abbot and convent of Begeham the whole of the land which he held from the said abbot and convent in West Kechenham. (c. 1210-20.) MS. Ch. Sussex 10.

LAMBERHURST. (see rent page) Theobald Strangboghe grants to William le Reve two acres of land and wood lying in the parish of Lamberherst, paying annually to him and his heirs one halfpenny. For this grant the said Theobald received 24s. sterling. (c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Sussex 14.
John de la Burne, with the assent of Agnes his wife, grants to the church of St. Mary of Begham a house in the parish of Lamberherst. (c. 1260-70.) [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 16a.

Tattered fragment of Letters patent dated 8 M[ay], 41 Ed. III., being a grant of a licence of mortmain to the abbot and convent of Beggeham, to enable them to buy 4 acres of land and 3 acres of meadow in Lamburhurst. [With fragment of a seal.} MS. Ch. Sussex 16b .

John ..... grants to Stephen Ers . . . and Richard Adam of Lamberherst one messuage and one rood of land in .... Dated at Lamberherst on the feast of the apostles SS. Philip and James, 2 Hen. V. In part effaced. MS. Ch. Sussex 22a.
Charter by which ..... in Lamberherst. Dated ... Hen. VII. [Illegible fragment] MS. Ch. Sussex 29.

Indenture dated 28 Jan., 13 Hen. VIII, by which Richard, the abbot, and convent of Beigham demise unto Thomas Wyllard of Lambertherst a house called the Owle house, &c., together with some lands about the said house &c., for 20 years, at an annual rent of 8s. [English] MS. Ch. Sussex 31.

MATTEFELD. William, son of Alexander de Mattefeld, grants and quit-claims to the church of St. Mary of Begeham for 4 marks the whole of his land in Mattefeld, viz. 18 acres and the third part of a messuage, (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 12.

NODINGEFORD. Robert de Glotingham grants to the church
of St. Mary of Beigham, in frankalmoigne, the half of his land of Nodingeford, viz. a fourth part of one knight's fee. (c. 1190-1200.) MS. Ch. Sussex 4.
OTHAM. Geoffrey de St. Leodegario [St. Leger] confirms to [the church of] St. Laurence and the canons of Otteham, in frankalmoigne, Eadward Crepp. (c. 1200.) MS. Ch. Sussex 2.
Roll containing rents, services, &c. due from Teletune and Otteham. MS. Ch. Sussex 6b.
