Robert Frendesbury, abbot of Beghame, and the convent of the same grant to farm to Henry Bakere of .... and John Drew of Otham, their manor of Otham for 20 years, paying to the abbot and convent of Begham five marks sterling, and to the prior and convent of Michelham 25 marks annually. Dated at Beghame on the Annunciation of the B.V. M., 6 Hen. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 21.

Indenture made 12 October, 9 Hen. VIII, by which the abbot and convent of Begham demise to John Ebody of Kent, yeoman, all their wood in Oteham, also their wood in Begham called Chapell woode, for . . years, at an annual rent of .... [Mutilated and in part effaced.] [English] MS. Ch. Sussex 26.

Indenture witnessing that Richard, the abbot, and convent of Begham demise to John Awod and Joan his wife, of the parish of Jenyngton, a piece of land in Otham in co. Sussex, called Grete Otham, for 40 years, at an annual rent of 10s. Dated at Beigham, 20 October, 19 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Sussex 30.

SCHARPESHULL. John de Doungate grants to William de Doungate, his brother, all his lands and tenements in Lambreherst lying at Scharpeshull, which he acquired from John Grout. Dated at Begeham on the morrow of the Circumcision, 18 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 20.

HAILESHAM. Acts of court (inrolled) concerning the right of the abbot and convent of Beigham to the church of Haylesham, Chichester diocese, an. 1285. [Roll mutilated and in part effaced.] MS. Rolls Sussex 4.

div.head: Priory of St. Bartholomew, Pynham, near Arundel

div.p: ARUNDEL. Herbert, son of Osmund, grants to the church of St. Bartholomew .... near the Causeways of Arundel, certain land of Anedelle, with a meadow adjacent, which he held from William de Harenge, (c. 1170-90.) [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 32.

William, the third earl of Sussex, confirms to the church of St. Bartholomew 'de Calceto, Arundel', the donation which Gilbert de Winton made to them of the messuage which Noel held in Arundel. (1196-1221.) MS. Ch. Sussex 33.
Faramus de .... sells and quit-claims for ever Walter son of Durand, to Robert the chaplain of the earl of Arundel, with all his goods and issue for half a mark. (c. 1210-1220?.) MS. Ch. Sussex 34.

Matilda, wife of John de Beauchamp ("Bellocampo") of Schorham, grants to the
church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, twenty [shillings] from a messuage which Bernard de H ..ha her father, gave to the canons to provide a light in the church at the altar of the Blessed Virgin, of which he had in dowry with his wife Matilda, mother of the above said Matilda; paying annually 6d. c. 1240-50. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 40.

Henry de Wisbereze quit-claims to Robert Mulet of the Causeway, for 5s. all right in a certain area at the Causeway which Adam the clerk, son of Robert the skinner, gave to him; paying annually 6d. Witness. Richard Dodding, then mayor of Arundel. (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 41.

Thomas, the prior, and the canons of the Causeway, Arundel, grant to William Bristlaf, clerk of Durington, for his service, all right and claim with curtilages and with all their appurtenances, which he had by the gift of sir Adam, chaplain of the Causeway, to hold, &c. of them and their successors to him and his heirs for ever, paying annually 20d. sterling at the feast of St. Michael, (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 42.

Joan, formerly wife of Ralph le Tayllur, grants to the church of St. Bartholomew, 'de Calceto Arundell', and the canons there 1 ½ acre of land which she and Ralph her husband gave to William and Christiana de Wowodesham. [c. 1240-50.] MS. Ch. Sussex 43.

Hugh, formerly servant of sir W. de Botiler at Lyministre, quitclaims to the church of St. Bartholomew 'of the Causeway, Arundel', and the prior and canons therein, for 5 marks all right in a messuage with a curtilage which Richard Morin held of the said canons. (c. 1270.) MS. Ch. Sussex 45.

John, son and heir of Peter Bagge of Arundel, grants to Matilda, wife of David of the Causeway, shoemaker, the whole of his tenement for 20 shillings without the bridge of Arundel; paying annually 11d to the chief lord. (c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Sussex 48.

Fragment of a composition between the church of the Causeway and R. parson of Chitehurst, with the authority of the bishop of Chichester, and consent of the patron of Chitehurst R, de Vesselier. (c. 1240-50.) This is recited in Ch. Sussex 60. MS. Ch. Sussex 50.

William Aguylion, lord of Nutburn, for the health of his soul, grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, in frankalmoigne, 8d. of annual rent from a certain messuage in Arundel. (c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Sussex 53.

Ysabella, daughter of Robert le Petir (?) of Arundel, grants to John, son of David the shoemaker of the Causeway, part of a garden on the west of the bakehouse ("furni") in which herself and her father formerly worked. (c. 1260-70.) [Slightly mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 54.

Sir Ranulf de Broc, kt., grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, the whole of the land which the abbot of Robert's Bridge gave them in frankalmoigne, which was sometime Robert le Justur's; paying annually 12d. (c. 1260-70.) [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 55.

Emma de Kyngestone, relict of William de la Broke, remits and quit-claims to Thomas, the prior, and canons of the Causeway, all her right by the name of dowry in a messuage with a curtilage near Arundel bridge with Richard Doding, mayor of Arundel. (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 57.
Lease of land from the prior and convent of Luke Shorte; dated at the priory ... after feast of St. Michael, 20 Edw. IV. [Much mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 76.

William Luey of Arundel grants to Acelina, daughter of Robert le Capiere, one acre of land in the territory of Arundel, paying annually 3d to the lord of Arundel, for which she gives him 28 shillings. (c. 1250-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 58.

William de Luci of Arundel grants to William Prentis for 2s a messuage in Potentestrete, paying to the prior and convent of the Causeway nine pence annually. Dated at Arundel on the morrow of [All] Souls, 5 Ed. II. Witness. John Alisandre, then mayor of Arundel. MS. Ch. Sussex 61.

William Toppe and Agnes his wife remit and quit-claim to John de Kepston and Alice his wife all their right in a tenement [at the Causeway] near Arundel. Dated at "le Cauec" near Arundel the Friday next before the feast of St. Dionisius, 21 Ed. [III]. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 62.

Henry, the prior, and the canons of the Causeway, near Arundel, grant to Thomas le Croucher, Joan his wife and John their son, a certain tenement at the Causeway for their lives, at an annual rent of 3s. Dated at the Causeway on the day of the Exaltation of the Cross, 30 (?) Ed. III. Witnesses. Thomas Couteler (or Conteler), mayor of Arundel. MS. Ch. Sussex 64.

Richard Mor . . . and Agnes his wife and Alice their daughter appoint John Clerk to deliver seisin to .... and Alice his wife, the whole of their tenement and croft at the Causeway near Arundel. Dated at Chichester the Monday on the feast of St. Andrew the apostle, 46 Ed. III. (This appears to be the date but in 46 Edw. III the feast fell on Tuesday) [Barely legible.] MS. Ch. Sussex 66.

John Merton (?), priest of the church of Haryngham, from sir Henry, prior of the Causeway, near Arundel, thirty .... shillings and [four pence (?)] for the lodging ("more") and victuals of a certain John le . . . . Dated at .... Feb. 1346. [Partially illegible and slightly mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 67.

John, the prior, and the canons of [St. Bartholomew of the Causeway] demise to Thomas ate Syndre and Alice his wife a tenement in Arundel at an annual rent of 3s. Dated at the Causeway the Monday next before the feast of the Invention of the Cross, 50 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 69.

Letter of credence from Thomas Essnynge, the mayor of the borough of Arundel and certain burgesses therein named, authorising Richard Skyer to collect for the repair of the Causeway and bridge at Arundel, which will fall unto ruin unless spedily repaired. Dated at Arundel on the feast of St. Leonard the abbot, 33 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Sussex 72.

The prior and convent of St. Bartholomew, Arundel, demise to John ...... called Strowdys in the parish of .... for 30 years, at an annual rent of 13s. 4d. [Mutilated, and almost entirely effaced.] MS. Ch. Sussex 75.

BILLINGHURST. Robert le Franceys of Billingehurst grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, in frankalmoigne, certain parcels of land in Billingehurst, with the homage and service of Bartholomeus to chaplain of Billingehurst and of Adam de la and a rent of 12d, for the sum of 40s "ad magnum negocium meum". (c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Sussex 37.

Acknowlegement by John Charrey, prior of the monastery of de Calceto of the receipt of 30 ... from John Wollere. Dated ... before feast of St. Edward K. d. M 3 (?) Henry VI. [In large part effaced.], MS. Ch. Suffolk 1375.

William de Arundel, clerk, remits and quit-claims to Stephen, the prior, and the canons of the Causeway, Arundel, 12d. of annual rent, in the parish of Billinghurst, which Robert le Franceis gave him. Witness. Robert de ...une, then seneschal of Arundel. (c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Sussex 38.

John de Palingefaud grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, in frankalmoigne, certain parcels of land in Billinghurst, viz. Westentonfeld, Istertonfeld, Garston, with the homage and service of Adam de la Fanne, and a rent of 12d. (c. 1250-60.) MS. Ch. Sussex 39.

Roger, called le ... , of Niwebrugge, remits and quit-claims to sir Thomas, the prior 'de Calceto, Arundel', .... an annual rent of 3d. which he was accustomed to receive .... at Niwebrugge in the parish of Billinghurst by the gift of the late William de Wokesham. [Mutilated.] (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 49.

John Charney, prior of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, and the convent of the same demise to Philip ate Aldre of Wysberghe a tenement called West Wodesham in the parish of Billynggushurst for 60 years at an annual rent of 6s. 8d. Dated at Calcetum the Saturday on the feast of St. Matthew, apostle, 22 Rich. II. MS. Ch. Sussex 71.

CHICHESTER. John Stokeman, citizen of Chichester, quitclaims to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, that messuage with a curtilage, which he had by the concession of Richard Champel, chaplain in the parish of St. Peter in Chichester. (c. 1270-80.) MS. Ch. Sussex 59.

Nicholas Plocat of Chichester, son and heir of Roger Plocat, remits and quit-claims to the prior and canons of the Causeway, Arundel, all his right &c. in 14d. annual rent, for a messuage in Chichester in the lane called Bakeleh Lane which the said prior and canons had by the gift of Gunnilda Hechemele. Witness. William de Wythsond, then mayor of Chichester. (c. 1250-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 36.

CHITEHURST. Certificate by Ivo, archdeacon of Chichester between Thomas, the prior, and convent of the Causeway, Arundel, and John le Wesselyr, rector of the church of Chitehurst, concerning an annual pension of 5s. for the tithe of the land which Roger de Kyngesham held in Chitehurst, in which the former composition (see MS. Ch. Sussex 50) is recited. Dated 1285. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 60.

HAMPTON. John le Justur of Wykes grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway of Arundel, 16d. of rent which the prior and canons were annually accustomed to pay him for two messuages and 7 acres of land in Hampton, which the said canons possess by his gift. (c. 1230-40.) MS. Ch. Sussex 35.

HAVEDELL. Katherine, the prioress, and the nuns of the monastery of Lenemenstre release to John L...., the prior and convent of the Causeway, Arundel, all claims arising from the lease of five acres of land near Havedell in the parish of , which the said priory held for a certain term of years now expired by grant from Robertthe then prior and convent to Joan the then prioress and convent. Dated at Lenemenstre on the vigil of the Purification, 5 Rich. II. Witnesses. John Michel, prior of Tostyngton, Robert vicar of Lenemenstre etc. MS. Ch. Sussex 70.
LYMINSTER. William Hareng, lord of Limestre, grants to Ralph Noel, for his service, and Christiana his wife, one tenement and land in Limestre. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Sussex 51.

OFFINGTON. Stephen de Offingtone grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, in frankalmoigne, an annual rent in the village of Offington. (c. 1260-70.) [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 46.

PALINGS. William de Wykes, chaplain, quit-claims to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, all his right and claim in an acre of land called Waksacre (?) of William Snel's in Palinges. (c. 1240-50.) MS. Ch. Sussex 44a.
PALINGES. Richard de Brom grants to John ......, which he held of the fee of Ranulf de Broc in the parish of Palinges, at an annual rent of one penny. (c. 1260-70) MS. Ch. Sussex 44b.

PRESTITON. William de Prestitone grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, in frankalmoigne, one virgate of land in Prestiton formerly belonging to sir John de Palingefaud, kt. and which he had by the gift of the late Thomas called le Burgeys of Arundell; for 20 marks and annual payment of 2s. 6d. (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Sussex 52.

[SEWEDON.?] Indenture witnessing that John Gyfford, prior of St. Bartholomew 'de Calceto, Arundel', and the convent of the same demise to John Apsle the whole of a wood called Stonyland near Selwoke(?), Sussex, to cut down and do away with ..... Dated 3 July, 11 Ed. IV. [Partly effaced.] MS. Ch. Sussex 73.

WARBLINGTON. Mutilated indenture between Henry, the prior, and the canons of the Causeway, Arundel, and John le Buteler, the lord of Lymbourne in the parish of Warblyngton giving him the appointing of a canon to priory for him, his mother Joan, and his wife Joan &c. in return for lands and tenements in Westbourne given to them by himself. Dated the Wednesday next before the feast of St. Martin, 1351. MS. Ch. Sussex 68.

WARNCAMP. Peter, son of Ansell, grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, and the canons of the same, in frankalmoigne, 4½ acres of land in the village of Warnecamp, on condition that they provide him with all necessaries during his life. (c. 1250-60.) [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 47.

William Caumvile grants to John Polyngs of Arundel and Alice his wife a garden and 1½ acre of land in Warnecampe. Dated at Warnecampe the Monday before the feast of St. Mark, 44 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Sussex 65.

Adam Baker (?) grants to William Camvile one garden and 1½ acre of arable land in the fields of Warnecamp. Dated at Warnecamp the Sunday next before the feast of St. George, 31 (?) Ed. III. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Sussex 63.

Peter, son of Ansell of Warnecamp, grants to the church of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, Arundel, in frankalmoigne, the whole of his messuage in Warnecamp. (c. 1250-60.) [Mutilated and in part effaced.] MS. Ch. Sussex 56.

WESTBORNE. Indenture witnessing that John Gifford, the prior of St. Bartholomew of the Causeway, and the convent of the
same demise to John Fisshere of Wodmancote in the parish of Westborne, and Joan his wife, and Richard and Alice children of the said John and Joan, a pasture lying within the lands of William, earl Arundel, for their lives, at an annual rent of 4s. Dated 1 July, 13 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Sussex 74.
